1.text: Is there not warfare to man upon the earth, and his days as the days of a hireling?

2.text: As the servant will gape for the shadow, and as the hireling will wait for his work:

3.text: So was I caused to possess to me months of vanity, and nights of toil were allotted to me.

4.text: If I lay down, and I said, When shall I arise, and the evening be measured? And I was filled with tossings even to the twilight.

5.text: And my flesh was clothed with worms, and a clod of dust; my akin was contracted and melted away.

6.text: My days were swift above a weaverâ€™s shuttle, and will finish with no more of hope.

7.text: Remember that my life is wind: mine eyes shall not turn back to see good.

8.text: The eye of him seeing me shall not look after me: thine eyes are upon me, and I am not.

9.text: The cloud will end and will go away: thus he shall go down to hades and shall not come up.

10.text: He shall turn back no more to his house, and his place shall know him no more.

11.text: Also I will not restrain my mouth; I will speak in the straitness of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

12.text: Am I the sea, or a dragon, that thou wilt set a watch over me?

13.text: For I said, My bed shall comfort me; my couch shall lift up in my complaint;

14.text: And thou didst terrify me with dreams, and thou wilt make me afraid with visions:

15.text: And my soul will choose strangling; death rather than my bones.

16.text: I melted away; I shall not live forever: desist from me, for my days are vanity.

17.text: What is man that thou wilt magnify him? and that thou wilt set thy heart to him?

18.text: And thou wilt review him for the mornings, and thou wilt try him for the moments.

19.text: How long wilt thou not look away from me? wilt thou not desist from me even to my swallowing down my spittle?

20.text: I sinned; what shall I do to thee, guarding men? wherefore didst thou set me for an assault to thee, and I shall be upon myself for a burden?

21.text: And why wilt thou not lift up my transgression and pass over mine iniquity? for now I shall lie down to the dust; and thou soughtest me and I was not.
